sponsor.partnerMessage: Since 1957, Underwoods has been committed to quality and value. Named "Coolest Store in America" by InStore Magazine, and winner of state, national, and international design awards, Underwoods' dedication to craftsmanship and design excellence creates timeless jewelry.

posts.title: Show Off Your Local Knowledge At Shiloh Museum’s Ozark Trivia Night
posts.topic: Sponsored by Shiloh Museum of Ozark History
posts.content:
How well do you know the Ozarks? Put your knowledge to the test at Ozark Trivia Night on Nov 10 at 7p at the Shiloh Museum of Ozark History in Springdale. 

  • Friendly competition: Register a team of up to six people, or come ready to make friends. There will be a raffle, prizes for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd places, and a prize for the Best Themed Table, so come dressed up in your favorite Ozark attire.  
  • Curious cats: Mr. T., the museum's feline ambassador, invites you to bring your curiosity, your cleverness, and your appetite. Snacks and locally crafted wine, beer, and cider will be available. 

Register before midnight on Nov 8 HERE.

posts.title: NWA Tech Summit A Success For The Region
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas Tech Summit returned last week to Bentonville in person after the previous two years went virtual.

  • Filling the gap: With all 1,700 attendees in person, Tyson Foods' CTO, Scott Spradley, pointed out there are more than 1,000 tech job openings in the region with hundreds of computer science specialists graduating from the U of A.
  • Going for gold: The event included workshops, breakout sessions, and competitions where students and founders competed for funding with national attention and credibility on the line. The Technology Summit plans to celebrate its 10th year when the conference convenes next fall in downtown Bentonville.

Read more about the event and participants HERE.

posts.title: Organic Grocery Store, Shopping, and Apartments Planned For Rogers
posts.content:
In October the City of Rogers Planning Commission approved an 80,000+ sq. ft development near the corner of Promenade Boulevard and New Hope Road in west Rogers.

  • Similar signs: The development, being led by SJC Ventures out of Georgia, includes apartments, shopping, and an Organic Grocery store. This isn't SJC Ventures' first development in NWA as they were behind the Whole Foods in Fayetteville.
  • The numbers: According to their site plan, the development will be +80K sq. ft of shopping and grocery, plus 350 residential apartment units.

Learn more about the project and site plan HERE.

posts.title: Business Travel Out Of XNA Making A Come Back
posts.content:
Federal data is showing how XNA is looking more and more like its pre-pandemic self. 

  • Baby come back: Voltaire Aviation’s review revealed XNA’s top destinations as Chicago and New York, core business destinations for travelers to and from Northwest Arkansas.
  • Back in business: Chicago and New York were XNA’s top destinations in 2019 before the pandemic interrupted air travel and triggered the rise of remote work. These latest trends suggest business travel is making a resurgence. 

Read more about travel trends HERE.

posts.title: Pastafina Voted Best Italian Restaurant in NWA
posts.content:
Only In Your State featured Pastafina as NWA’s best Italian restaurant. 

  • Vibes: Located at 1045 E Lowell Ave in Cave Springs, the restaurant has a cozy, casual atmosphere and serves up pasta that will rival your grandma’s. 
  • Bon appetit: The article recommended the chicken parmesan and the penne and meatballs, or the salmon piccata for seafood lovers. Save room for their delicious tiramisu, if you’re able - their portions are huge! 

Check out the restaurant highlight HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Oh, oh, oh it’s magic: Touring illusionist, Reza, is performing at the Jones Center this upcoming Sunday, Nov 6 at 2p. Get your tickets before they disappear HERE.*
  • Great gear, anytime, anywhere: Ozark Outdoor Gear Rental provides premium camping, backpacking, and climbing gear along with flexible delivery & pickup to suit your needs for your next adventure!*
  • Barefoot boogie: The 75th annual Ozark Folk Festival returns on Nov 10 for three days of amazing folk music in the beautifully historic Eureka Springs.*
  • The kings: Fayetteville’s new John L Colbert Middle School has picked the Cobras as its mascot, and we really hope students will come to school every day like this… 
  • Join us: Would you like to share something in our newsletter? Check out our deals HERE. 

*Content is sponsored
